title: Implement task-level progressive disclosure for AI agent rule discovery
description:
Current State: âœ… MAJOR PROGRESS - Solutions 1, 2, and 4 implemented!

## Completed

### âœ… Solution 1: Discovery Preamble (1-2h) - DONE
- Added comprehensive progressive disclosure instructions to .claude/RULES.md

### âœ… Solution 2: Hierarchical Structure (4-6h) - DONE
- Implemented .claude/rules/ directory with base/, languages/, frameworks/, cloud/

**Before**: Monolithic .claude/RULES.md

**After**: Hierarchical .claude/rules/

## Impact

Successfully implemented task-level progressive disclosure:

description: Define progressive disclosure framework for applying appropriate rigor based on project maturity. Include: (1) MVP/POC/Prototype level - focus on speed, learning, validation with minimal overhead (skip: comprehensive testing, extensive monitoring, complex architecture patterns, production-grade security beyond basics); (2) Pre-Production/Beta level - moderate rigor with basic testing, security fundamentals, simple monitoring; (3) Production level - full rigor with comprehensive testing, security, observability, performance optimization, disaster recovery. Provide decision matrix for which base/ rules apply at each level, and guidance on graduating from one level to another. This enables AI assistants to tailor recommendations based on project phase.

title: PHASE 9: Update sync-ai-rules.sh to detect project maturity level and apply appropriate rigor
description: Extend sync-ai-rules.sh to detect project maturity level (MVP/POC/Prototype, Pre-Production, Production) and sync only the appropriate subset of rules. Detection heuristics: (1) Check for .maturity or project config files with explicit maturity declaration; (2) Infer from presence of production infrastructure (Dockerfile, CI/CD, monitoring configs = Production); (3) Infer from package.json version (0.x.x = MVP/POC, 1.x.x+ = Production); (4) Check for production domains/environment variables; (5) Default to MVP if ambiguous, with prompt to user. Add --maturity flag to override auto-detection. Sync subsets: MVP gets base essentials only (architecture-principles, testing-philosophy, ai-assisted-development), Pre-Production adds security and CI/CD, Production gets full ruleset.
